Leandro Stasi Kanashiro wrote:
>  
> 
> Does Any one have use cmdline-jmx from remote??
> 
>  
> 
> I can connect to the service locally but not from remote.
> 
> When I connect from remote I get an connect refuse from 127.0.0.1

It sounds as though you may be supplying '127.0.0.1' as the
address to which to connect. If so, remember that '127.0.0.1'
is a special 'loopback' address that always refers to the
local machine. You can use it when connecting locally, but would
have to use the target machine's external IP if connecting
from elsewhere.

If this isn't it, please provide the command-lines you've used
that work (locally) and don't work (remotely), in addition to
the error seen.

- Gordon @ IA
